fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26765].
  {panel}

h4. Symptoms

When a page name contains a special character, this character is included in the ID of any anchors on the page. When generating the URL for such anchors, Confluence is encoding any text to the right of the \# using HTML entity escaping, but for this link to work, it must use URL encoding. This also happens if an anchor name contains a special character.

For example the apostrophe character:

* The URL is currently replacing it with '
* The URL should be replacing it instead with %27 like it does on the left side of the \#
* The anchor is showing up correctly in the page source, as the apostrophe is not encoded inside the id attribute

Note that whilst using special characters in an ID is [prohibited in XML|http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml/#NT-NameStartChar] and thus XHTML, it's [perfectly fine for HTML5|http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/elements.html#the-id-attribute], which is used by Confluence, so any special characters do not need to be encoded inside the id attribute.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a page named "User's Resources"
2. Add an anchor to it, say "shares", a link to the anchor in the same page (or any other) and save
3. Click the link
4. No redirect is made (or if the link is in a different page, redirect is made only to the page, not the anchor)

This is the link:
{code}<confluence_instance>/display/<space_name>/User%27s+Resources#User'sResources-shares{code}

This behavior happens because of the special character used in the title - If the page is renamed without it, everything works.

h4. Workaround

If this is caused by the page name, the only workaround is to rename that page to not have a special character.

If this is caused by the anchor name, you can work around this by manually URL-escaping the special character in the "Link" value in "Advanced" when creating the link.
fields.summary: Redirect to anchors in pages with titles that contain special characters is broken

Sometimes when installing Confluence, a custom JDBC driver may be needed. This could be because of various reasons, including, but not limited to:

# An official driver is not distributed with Confluence, such as for Oracle
# A customisation is required in the JDBC driver

Currently the installer won't prompt for this, and will immediately start Confluence without prompting, so it needs to be stopped first, and then manually have a JDBC driver installed before starting again, and continuing the install.

If there is a prompt to install this driver during the install and upgrade steps, this will save on the effort of restarting, and also gives an opportunity to make the administrator aware that they need such a driver, if their configuration needs it.
fields.summary: Add an option to specify a custom JDBC driver in the installer

Sometimes, an applied "Effect" for an inserted image no longer shows in the WYSIWYG.

To replicate the problem:

1. Edit a page, insert an image, choose an Effect, add a caption to it.
2. Save the page.
3. Edit the page again: for the same image as above, click on Caption again, change the caption text around a little bit (text and positioning), then lock in that change against the image.

--> In the resulting WYSIWYG display (even before the Save), you will no longer see the applied Effect of the image.

You can now click on the image and apply the Effect again, but in the modal window, you will see that the effect is actually still applied. When you click on it again, and commit the change, it now shows again.

For any questions, please just get in touch with me.

h1. List editing/adding

h2. Problem
List's can be *hard and pain* to edit/create. I don't say this following example is everyday problem but *it will* rise *negative* attitude from users, towards the application.

Let's see now.. ah yes, let's now think that we are trying to create a "*how to*" -documentation that looks *some what* professional. 

# Now you are in the point of creating *a step by step* list and you start to write the list open: 
{code}
1. Browse there and do this
   <Picture of the step possibly>
2. Browse here and do that
   a. This Section: Does many things and they are opened more below
      * This button, will make world a happy place
      * This button, will blow up the moon
      * This button, will make you rich
   <First braking point>
   b. Configuration
      * Here is the default values
      <2x4 table>
   <Second breaking point>
{code}
# In the *first braking point*: 
## You try to switch back to *numbered list* the counting starts again and it *won't let you* to change the "*a.*" to "*b.*". *Every time* you try it *reverts* back to "*a.*"
## Now you are *getting frustrated*, and you put your cursor *end of* "*This button, will make you rich*" bullet and press *Enter* 3 times. It will *separate* the bullet-ed list from the numbered list. But yeah.. you can always "*fix*" this by *removing* the extra line so no biggie.. But then you *select* the "*b. Configuration*" numbered list and *BOOM!!* the extra line is there *again*?
## *By now* you are a bit giddy about the whole thing, but at the same time a bit angry/sad. You think: *Maybe just forget* the whole making the how-to documentation then you *remember* that you where a "*wiki-markup guru*" and make the list by /+insert -> *wiki-markup*.
{code}
# Browse here and do that
## This Section: Does many things and they are opened more below
*** This button, will make world a happy place
*** This button, will blow up the moon
*** This button, will make you rich
## Configuration
*** Here is the default values
{code} 
## *Boom!* *Voila*, you jump in *happiness* that you just created *good looking* list by *remembering wiki-markup*!
# And now you *happily* move on to the *Second breaking point*
## You start by creating a table "*Table*" -> You *select 2x4 table*, *WOOSH!* That was quick.. oh wait what's that bullet in front of the table? I'll just remove it so it looks more professional. Oh there is an extra line also let's delete that as well. Now let's punch up the numbers.. *done!* .. good everything *seems* ok.. now let's *continue* the numbered list so the next should bee... "*c.*" alright.. *Press enter* after the table, hmm.. ok? it brought you an *empty line*. Let's just try to *out-dent* the line. \*Click\* AARHG it out-dented the *bullet* that was *above* the table and it converted it to *numbered list*!?
## And you *spend hours*(which you could have used to make the page complete)of *fixing* a *single* document when you *finally* realize that you could just do it with *wiki markup*.

h2. Solution suggestion
I really don't "know" the *solution* but when *using lists* in *rich-text* it really raises *few gray hairs*. *AND* if you didn't *use* pre *Confluence 4.0* or didn't know wiki-markup.. You just *couldn't* do decent looking lists.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-26575].
  {panel}

One of the most powerful aspects of Confluence is its email notification of new and changed content. This topic has been discussed in Confluence forums since at least 2006, but no significant action has been taken by Atlassian except for renaming the "Minor change" box to "Notify watchers." I still haven't seen any posting that summarizes the issues as my wiki users and I see them. This is an update to http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257301891.

The problem is that users receive too many email notifications that most people consider unhelpful at best and very annoying at worst. The control mechanisms currently available in Confluence are inadequate to control sending email notifications, and "watch" options available to users can not make up for this deficiency.

We can divide actions and content into new, edited and removed pages, comments, news, and attachments as summarized below:

Content Type	New	Edited	Removed
Page	-	X	-
Comment	-	-	-
News/blog	-	-	-
Attachment	-	-	-


The X shows the only option, as far as I can tell, for preventing sending email notifications.

Per this chart, email notifications are automatically sent out for ALL combinations EXCEPT for edited pages based on whether users check the "Notify watchers" option box. This same box could easily be made available for editing comments and blog entries and adding or removing attachments. (Searching Confluence forums for "minor change" provides several conversations on this matter back at least to 2006.) 

We find particularly annoying email notifications resulting from removing or moving content. As administrator, I have removed pages, comments, and attachments as inappropriate or obsolete and have almost certainly not wanted to bring attention to that removed content. I also move pages, frequently to archival folders, and the only way to prevent email alerting messages from blasting users is to turn off the email function as an administrator. Using WebDAV to move or remove entries generates email blizzards.

We also believe email notifications about attachments (added, moved, or removed) to be of very low value. Attachments are almost always supporting or described by the page content itself which will be the subject of its own email notification.

My users and I believe it is past time for Atlassian to provide users and administrators better control in Confluence over sending these email notifications. This includes, but is not limited to, improving the "Notify watchers" option with clear option buttons or similar mechanisms as discussed in other forum entries.

I look forward to elaboration of this issue by other users and action by Atlassian on this matter.

It can be very useful for both Confluence users and support engineers to have an entry by default in the logs everytime an user removes a space or a page.

This way it would be a lot easier to determine when a page/space is removed and who did the action.

I tried with different filters in web.xml but they don't display the page removed. You can deduct this by adding full access logs, but I find it excessive when you only want to get part of the information.

If this cannot be made by default, it could be useful to have a way to achieve in the UI or at least in Confluence documentation.
